SENT.plain: Two cases are presented, both males with severe total spondylolisthesis and both with Marfan's syndrome
One was treated by decompression and posterolateral fusion and the other by decompression, posterolateral fusion, reduction by halo-femoral traction, and then anterior fusion
Both had excellent results in terms of pain relief and relief of severe hamstring tightness
One patient subsequently died of a dissecting aneurysm
A relationship between Marfan's syndrome and spondylolisthesis is strongly suggested
